result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 21 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they were prescribed. .

Expunction is conditionally granted upon successful completion of probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with co-defendant.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment is established.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit for 21 days were granted.  Any excess credit from case 14CF1192 to be applied to this case.

defendant.name: Reed, Ashley A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Ashley A Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties address the errors in the report.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Benedict makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court will ignore the revocation and warrant filed. 
Court orders the following:  Count #1.  
 
Imposed:
180 days jail (credit of 21 days).  Any excess credit from case #14CF1192 to be applied to this case. 

Fees previously waived.

Received October 27, 2016,   Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea and Sentencing Hearing February 16, 2015, transcript held in 14CF1192, filed by Court Reporter Kathy Redlin
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Probation Revoked/Sentencing after Revocation document received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ashley A Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 21 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  No contact with codefendant.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after treatment is established.
- Court grants expunction upon written request of the defendant and upon successful completion of Probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Ashley A Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley A Reed

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant allowed non collect phone call

Defendant Ashley A Reed in court, in custody, with attorney Beth Weathers for  Samuel W. Benedict.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
